Pharos

High-Performance RFC 2378 Server Ecosystem

A highly performant, read-optimized client-server ecosystem based on the Phonebook Protocol. Built for Enterprise Engineers and Home Labbers running Proxmox/LXC.

View on GitHub Read Documentation

Pharos delivers a secure, multi-tiered architecture capable of handling extreme read volume (80-90%+) with zero-host execution and comprehensive DevSecOps tooling.

Ecosystem Components

Everything you need for enterprise-grade directory services

pharos-server

The core backend routing "people" vs "machine" queries natively. Features tiered storage spanning in-memory for dev, file-level for LXC, and LDAP for enterprise.

ph CLI

Ultra-fast, lightweight cross-platform client designed specifically for finding and managing people contacts.

mdb CLI

Specialized command-line tool for querying and managing machine and infrastructure assets within your network.

Engineering Excellence

Zero-Host Execution

Strict Podman container isolation ensures environmental parity and absolute security for CI pipelines and development.

Cross-Platform Binaries

Automated builds for x86_64-linux, aarch64-darwin, and x86_64-windows for seamless multi-environment deployment.

SSH-Key Authentication

Zero-password write operations validated against standard `~/.ssh/keys` for robust DevSecOps compliance.

AGPL-3.0 Licensed

Empowering Home Labbers while assuring that corporate deployments share modifications back with the community.
